content: Offerings of the Leaders

Now it came to pass, when Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, that he anointed it and consecrated it and all its furnishings, and the altar and all its utensils; so he anointed them and consecrated them.
Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ houses, who  the leaders of the tribes and over those who were numbered, made an offering.
And they brought their offering before the , six covered carts and twelve oxen, a cart for  two of the leaders, and for each one an ox; and they presented them before the tabernacle.
Then the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Accept  from them, that they may be used in doing the work of the tabernacle of meeting; and you shall give them to the Levites,  every man according to his service.”
So Moses took the carts and the oxen, and gave them to the Levites.
Two carts and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service;
and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
But to the sons of Kohath he gave none, because theirs  the service of the holy things,  they carried on their shoulders.
Now the leaders offered the dedication  for the altar when it was anointed; so the leaders offered their offering before the altar.
For the  said to Moses, “They shall offer their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
And the one who offered his offering on the first day  Nahshon the son of Amminadab, from the tribe of Judah.

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented

his offering he offered one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
On the third day Eliab the son of Helon, leader of the children of Zebulun,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, leader of the children of Reuben,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, leader of the children of Simeon,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
On the sixth day Eliasaph the son of Deuel, leader of the children of Gad,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, leader of the children of Ephraim,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
On the eighth day Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, leader of the children of Manasseh,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, leader of the children of Benjamin,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, leader of the children of Dan,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ocran, leader of the children of Asher,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Pagiel the son of Ocran.
On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, leader of the children of Naphtali,

His offering  one silver platter, the weight of which  one hundred and thirty  and one silver bowl of seventy shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten  full of incense;
one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb in its first year, as a burnt offering;
one kid of the goats as a sin offering;
and as the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs in their first year. This  the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
This  the dedication  for the altar from the leaders of Israel, when it was anointed: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, and twelve gold pans.
Each silver platter  one hundred and thirty  and each bowl seventy  All the silver of the vessels  two thousand four hundred  according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
The twelve gold pans full of incense  ten  apiece, according to the shekel of the sanctuary; all the gold of the pans  one hundred and twenty
All the oxen for the burnt offering  twelve young bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs in their first year twelve, with their grain offering, and the kids of the goats as a sin offering twelve.

And all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace offerings were twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the male goats sixty, and the lambs in their first year sixty. This  the dedication  for the altar after it was anointed.

Now when Moses went into the tabernacle of meeting to speak with Him, he heard the voice of One speaking to him from above the mercy seat that  on the ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim; thus He spoke to him.
